main event: On August 26, 1960, multiple witnesses reported seeing a bright, oval-shaped object hovering and performing erratic maneuvers in the sky over Springville, New York.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be approximately 40 to 75 feet in diameter and emitted a bright, pulsating light., Witnesses described the object making sudden, abrupt changes in movement and rapidly disappearing from sight., The sighting lasted for approximately 4 minutes., Some witnesses believed the object may have been an unidentified aerial phenomenon, while one account suggested it resembled common astronomical objects., No physical evidence or photographs were gathered during the incident.
sighted object: a bright, oval-shaped object emitting pulsating light in the sky
witness description: witnesses included drivers and pedestrians who observed the object at night
